name: In Search of Lost Time
description: Swann's Way, the first part of A la recherche de temps perdu, Marcel Proust's seven-part cycle, was published in 1913. In it, Proust introduces the themes that run through the entire work.

name: Ulysses
description: Ulysses chronicles the passage of Leopold Bloom through Dublin during an ordinary day, June 16, 1904. The title parallels and alludes to Odysseus.

name: Don Quixote
description: Alonso Quixano, a retired country gentleman in his fifties, lives in an unnamed section of La Mancha with his niece and a housekeeper.

name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: One of the 20th century's enduring works, One Hundred Years of Solitude is a widely beloved and acclaimed novel known throughout the world, and the ultimate achievement in a Nobel Prizewinning car.

name: The Great Gatsby
description: The novel chronicles an era that Fitzgerald himself dubbed the Jazz Age. Following the shock and chaos of World War I, American society enjoyed unprecedented levels of prosperity during the.

name: Moby Dick
description: First published in 1851, Melville's masterpiece is, in Elizabeth Hardwick's words,  The saga of Captain Ahab and his monomaniacal pursuit.
